description: Users may encounter an issue where they are unable to resize the C: drive due to the position of the WinRE partition being immediately adjacent to it. This situation often necessitates manual intervention to manipulate the partition sizes successfully. The process involves several steps including backing up the device, deleting all system restore points, and disabling system restore. After performing cleanup and administrative actions, users must carefully calculate the necessary adjustments based on the current size and available free space of the WinRE partition, specifically ensuring that there is sufficient space to create the new partition. If the existing WinRE partition is too small or positioned improperly, users may experience frustrations when attempting to manage their disk space effectively.
